instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - ODD ONE THIS...
threads.message:
Anyone work this out?

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Starts (goes through 3 start cycle correctly). chimes, turns on fully then 5 seonds later shuts amps down to 164ma.  Won't restart properly. Turn on, fan spin but no cycling and sits at 164ma or so.

Leave it off for 10 mins and we are back to the beginning and it starts, chimes and then drops to around170ma.

If you turn it off and DON'T wait the 10 mins or so, it will not trun on at all and sits at 23ma (missing 5v rail?)

Strangest one I have had yet.

All rails correct when on. 5v, 3.3, 1.2, 1.05, 3.42 & 1.8v. No idea what this is.

Seems that when it has cooled down we are fine. So somthing failing when hot? But what?
